meanings.definition: Able to be imagined or conceived.
meanings.sent1: The unicorn had the most imaginable colors in its mane.
meanings.sent2: It was the most imaginable solution to the problem.
meanings.sent3: The children's game was full of imaginable creatures and adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was an imaginable masterpiece of colors and shapes.
meanings.sent5: The story painted an imaginable world of magic and wonder.

meanings.definition: Within the scope of one's imagination.
meanings.sent1: The treasure hunt was the most imaginable game for the kids.
meanings.sent2: The idea of flying cars seemed imaginable in the future.
meanings.sent3: The cat's imaginable plan to catch the mouse failed hilariously.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were an imaginable journey through time and space.
meanings.sent5: The garden was an imaginable paradise of flowers and butterflies.
